H0.text: Gravity is the term for the force that brings objects toward the earth.

H1.text: Weight is the term for the force that brings objects toward the earth.

H2.text: Light is the term for the force that brings objects toward the earth.

H3.text: Centrifugal is the term for the force that brings objects toward the earth.

A4.text: Gravity is the word used to describe a physical law, a fundamental physical interaction that derives primarily from mass, and the observed consequences of that interaction on objects.

A5.text: The force of gravity is weakest at the equator because of the centrifugal force caused by the Earth's rotation and because points on the equator are farthest from the center of the Earth.
